xxl.relational
Class MergedResultSetMetaData

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.relational.MergedResultSetMetaData
public abstract class MergedResultSetMetaData
extends Object
implements ResultSetMetaData

This abstract class is a ResultSetMetaData skeleton that wraps two given ResultSetMetaData-objects. This is useful i.e. for Joins. There are four abstract methods:

  • int getColumnCount()
  • int originalMetaData(int column)
  • int originalColumnIndexFrom1(int column)
  • int originalColumnIndexFrom2(int column)
For each call to getXXX(int column) it is first called originalMetaData(column) to decide whether the column
  • belongs to the first MetaData or
  • belongs to the second MetaData or
  • it is a merged(computed) column.
For columns that belong to the first(second) MetaData the getXXX(int column)-call is redirected to getXXX(originalColumnIndexFrom1(column)) (originalColumnIndexFrom2 respectively).
For merged columns the behaviour of a method depends on the behaviour of the underlying columns. i.e. the columnDisplaySize is the maximum of the of the corresponding columns from both underlying MetaData-objects.
